channel.title: Accepted at SF
channel.description:
We have been ACCEPTED!!!!
Now, they say it will take about 12hours or something until the CVS/SVN stuff will be activated.
[u]CVS[/u] CVSROOT: :ext:hybridscape@cvs.sourceforge.net:/cvsroot/hybridscape PROTOCOL: :ext: USERNAME: hybridscape PASSWORD: you know what it is :P (if you don't ask me, silab, fasga, mopar, or newbiehacker) MODULE: hybridscape
[u]SVN[/u] SVN: https://svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/hybridscape USERNAME and PASSWORD: same as CVS
[u]HTTP[/u] HTTP: http://hybridscape.sourceforge.net/
<3 SF
If you already had another SVN/CVS in your hybridscape folder, to make TortoiseSVN/CVS forget about the old repositories simply delete all the .cvs/SVN named files in each folder
ANYWAY
In the CVS the comments will work, so I decided, why not have each of us login to the CVS with a different username?
I'm like, "Z0MG" Good idea! That way, when we write comments, we'll know who made them, eh?
Now, the only downside is that you have to a tiny registration on the SourceForge website and then I have to manually add you, now I need opinions
Should we all have the same username (hybridscape) or should we have seperate ones?
[b]Note: SVN is only for the public, so only put COMPLETELY TESTED AND FULLY WORKING releases there[/b] To mopar: The SVN is already open access (checkout) ;)

item.title: Accepted at SF
item.dc:creator: @Fasga Fasga
item.description:
@Fasga wrote:

And I was just getting used to SVN

Read full topic

item.title: Accepted at SF

item.description:
@sppt wrote:

woohoo, GJ Rictoo

Read full topic

item.title: Accepted at SF
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

i was talking too rictoo about that and was thinking lets wait before we go public with the svn till we putout a real version

Read full topic

item.title: Accepted at SF
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

in addition to that, can you make the svn either configured for open access (to check out only, obviously) or make another user and pass that all the noobs can use to get hybridscape?

Read full topic

item.title: Accepted at SF
item.dc:creator: @newbiehacker newbiehacker
item.description:
@newbiehacker wrote:

FINALLY
I agree with mopar

Read full topic

item.title: Accepted at SF
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

definatly seperate accounts, that way if somone doesnt comment, or submits code that wont compile, we can kick them from the dev team

(im not joking :D)

Read full topic

item.title: Accepted at SF
item.dc:creator: @l3etal3lade l3etal3lade
item.description:
@l3etal3lade wrote:

Rictoo can you PM me the pass?

Read full topic

item.title: Accepted at SF
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

seperate ones i hate big confusing passwords like the one for hybridscape

Read full topic

item.title: Accepted at SF
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

We have been ACCEPTED!!!

Now, they say it will take about 12hours or something until the CVS/SVN stuff will be activated.

CVS
CVSROOT: :ext:hybridscape@cvs.sourceforge.net:/cvsroot/hybridscape
PROTOCOL: :ext:
USERNAME: hybridscape
PASSWORD: you know what it is (if you don’t ask me, silab, fasga, mopar, or newbiehacker)
MODULE: hybridscape

SVN
SVN: https://svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/hybridscape
USERNAME and PASSWORD: same as CVS

HTTP
HTTP: http://hybridscape.sourceforge.net/

<3 SF

If you already had another SVN/CVS in your hybridscape folder, to make TortoiseSVN/CVS forget about the old repositories simply delete all the .cvs/SVN named files in each folder

ANYWAY

In the CVS the comments will work, so I decided, why not have each of us login to the CVS with a different username?

I’m like, “Z0MG” Good idea!
That way, when we write comments, we’ll know who made them, eh?

Now, the only downside is that you have to a tiny registration on the SourceForge website and then I have to manually add you, now I need opinions

Should we all have the same username (hybridscape) or should we have seperate ones?

Note: SVN is only for the public, so only put COMPLETELY TESTED AND FULLY WORKING releases there
To mopar: The SVN is already open access (checkout)

Read full topic
